subject: Re: [junit] How to write a test case for File operations?
msgSnippet: ... java.io.File provides methods to verify whether a file exists. Use them. java.io.File provides methods for reading the contents of a file. Use them. See
messageBody:
>So said Kabarnacius Anandaraj on 2003-07-24 --------------------
>Hi friends,
>I do not know how to write a test case for this kind
>of situations like
>
>Public void createFile()
>{
> File file = new File(File path);
>}
>public void updateFile(String message)
>{
> here I am opening a file and update the messages
>}
>How to write a test case file is created or not and
>message is updated or not
>Please help me is possible write a test case for this
>methods.

java.io.File provides methods to verify whether a file exists. Use them.

java.io.File provides methods for reading the contents of a file. Use them.

See what happens. If you don't like the resulting tests, then tell us why.

There is nothing special about the tests you want to write. Just try writing them.

- update the file with text
- read the file's text
- check that the file's text contains what you added

Good luck.
